metadata.title: CVE-2021-47314 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: memory:fsl_ifc: fix leak of private memory on probe failure On probe error thedriver should free the memory allocated for private structure. Fix this byusing resource-managed allocation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47314` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-156-generic - 4.15.0-156.163
linux-image-4.15.0-156-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-156.163
linux-image-4.15.0-156-lowlatency - 4.15.0-156.163
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-156-generic - 4.15.0-156.163
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-156-lowlatency - 4.15.0-156.163
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-87-generic - 5.4.0-87.98~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-87-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-87.98~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-87-lowlatency - 5.4.0-87.98~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-87-generic - 5.4.0-87.98~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-87-lowlatency - 5.4.0-87.98~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1099-kvm - 4.15.0-1099.101
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1111-aws - 4.15.0-1111.118
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1057-aws - 5.4.0-1057.60~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1123-azure - 4.15.0-1123.136
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1059-azure - 5.4.0-1059.62~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1108-gcp - 4.15.0-1108.122
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1053-gcp - 5.4.0-1053.57~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1010-ibm - 5.4.0-1010.11~18.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1080-oracle - 4.15.0-1080.88

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-156.163').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-87.98~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1099.101').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1111.118').
linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-5.3').

linux-aws-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1057.60~18.04.1').

linux-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1069.78').
